entry.p: I'll bet that the English word "outstanding" is confusing to non-native speakers, because it has two wildly divergent meanings:

li.p: Much better than others. (Cf. superlative, excellent, exceptional, extraordinary, etc.)
Not yet dealt with. (Cf. unfinished, remaining, incomplete, unpaid, etc.)

entry.p: I think I'll avoid this word from now on. :)
